entry.title: Annie Leibovitz's portraits
entry.content:
A wonderful exhibition of women’s portraits in an unusual
setting. Annie Leibovitz’s photographs reflect the changes
of the roles of women today.
EWZ Unterwerk Selnau, Selnaustr. 25
Mon - Sun 10am - 5.00pm, Thurs - 7.00pm
free entrance

entry.title: Magical iceskating
entry.content:
Zurich‘s most romantic ice rink is located in the inner courtyard of the National Museum, close to Zurich Main Train Station.

The backdrop of this ring is the museum building resembling a fairytale castle. Particular highlights include the night-time illuminations on the facades of the National Museum, as well as the festive decorations, complete with Christmas trees, heated tents, cozy alpine huts, fondue parlors, a lounge and various bars. Skating ring open: Mo through Fri from 2.00pm and Sat/Sun form 11.00am

entry.title: Museum Bellerive, a colourful methamorphosis
entry.content:
Out of materials that have served their purpose a Berber tribe
uses woold from old pullovers to weave carpets, blankets and cushions of
high quality and contemporary design. This exhibition will be the sendoff for
the villa on Lake Zurich and will definitely bring colour in Zurich’s fall and winter.
Tue-Sun 10.00am-5.00pm www.museum-bellerive.ch

entry.title: Zurich Street Food Festival
entry.content:
Enjoy food from over 100 vendors at the Zurich Street Food Festival. There is a
great varity of wonderful food from all over the world, an outdoor industrial
playground for adults with minigolf and pingpong, live music performance, bars,
just the perfect place to enjoy a wonderful late summer evening.

Street Food Festival Nr. 6: 8. - 18. September 2016

  • Mo - Fr: 17 - 24h
  • Sa: 11 - 24h
  • So: 11 - 22h

Take the tram or bus to Hardplatz/Hardbrücke/Güterbahnhof.
http://www.streetfoodfest.ch/

entry.title: Swim in the refreshing river
entry.content:
Werdinsel, a hidden, cozy spot is a little island between the Limmat and a smaller river.
You can swim in the river under the shade of big trees and feel miles away from the city.
Flussbad Au-Höngg can be reached by the bus 80 and 89 to Höhenklingensteig or
by Tram 13 to Wartau

entry.title: A bit of history
entry.content:
When you stroll down the Neumarkt, which is one of the prettiest street in the Old Town, make sure
to stop by the CITY ARCHIVES on Neumarkt 4. Inside the remarkable Haus zum Rechberg you will find
a historical exhibition and a scale model of the historical city. As you will notice in 1800 Zurich was
surrounded by a town wall, part of the original wall can still be seen inside the excellent Restaurant
Kantorei just next door. The fountain in front of the Kantorei dates back to the 15th century and was
originally called Nike fountain. It was rebuilt in 1987 and today is called Jupiterbrunnen.
Opening hours (free entrance) of the archives: Monday through Friday 8.00am till 6.00pm and
Saturday 10am till 4.00pm

entry.title: Manifesta 11,European Biennal for Contemporary Art
entry.content:
Manifesta, brings the visual arts together with the urban, social, historical, economical, ecological and architectural context.

Manifesta 11, with its theme “What People Do for Money: Some Joint Ventures”, focuses attention on the relation between artistic work and labour. In our post-industrial age, it is a concept that resonates acutely with life not only in Zurich but in the rest of the world.

Various location throughout the city: 11.6.–18.9.2016

entry.title: Gardens of the world
entry.content:
Gardens tell stories - stories of a yearning for paradise, stories of love, retreat, power and beauty. Museum Rietberg invites you to take a stroll through the world of gardens from Japan to England.

Located in the beautiful and historic park - the Rieterpark - the museum itself will form part of a unique exhibition for garden-lovers.

http://www.rietberg.ch/de-ch/home.aspx

entry.title: bikes to borrow for free
entry.content:
Zurich is a great place to cycle around, and all you need to do is stop by Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental, grab yourself a pair of wheels and go explore the city or bike along the lake.

In order to loan a bike from Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental, they require you leave some kind of ID, plus a small deposit in case you cause any damage to the bike. (you will even find bikes with kids seats, children’s bikes and at a charge of CHF 20.00 electric bikes, check the locations on where they have these special bikes available)

There are several spots in the city where you can find a Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental depot, including near the train station on Museumstrasse, at the Bahnhofstrasse Globus store, at Bellvue or at Bürkliplatz

https://www.stadt-zuerich.ch/aoz/de/index/shop/veloverleih/unsere-flotte.html#contenttabs

entry.title: Zurich's biggest photography art walk
entry.content:
A centre stage for photographers! In an industrial-looking building, on the main floor, you will always find a carefully curated photo exhibition of a well know photographer (where the photographs can be purchased) but just as interesting is the 3rd floor where the PHOTOBASTEI rents at a reasonable price exhibition space to local photographers in order for them to have an opportunity to show their work.

Also worth mentioning is the cool bar and café where they often feature live music and last but not least the cute French bulldog Bubu who always circles amongst the visitors.

www.photobastei.ch - Sihlquai 125
  • Tue/Wed 12.00 - 9.00pm,
  • Thur/Fri/Sat 12.00am - 12.00pm,
  • Sund 12.00 am - 6.00pm

entry.title: On a sunny day
entry.content:
Why not rent a pedalo , a rowing boat or a small motor boat and take a cruise on the lake of Zurich. The rental places are very centrally located, right by Bellevue.

Prices start at CHF 19.00 for pedalo rentals.
  • www.pier7.ch
  • www.lago-zuerich.ch

entry.title: For lovers of good architecture
entry.content:
A library designed by Sanitago Calatrava. The old building of Hermann Fitz was built in 1909.

Calatrava received the assignment in 1989 to build the library for the law faculty of the university of Zurich. The exterior stayed pretty much untouched. Calatrava placed a giant wood construction in the atrium of the existing building. The oval skylight has an integrated mechanical sun shade.

The library has 5000 meters space for books and 500 working places. It is stunning and worth seeing.

Rämistrasse 74, 8001 Zürich (just a few steps from the Plattenhof)

entry.title: Unique fashion accessories
entry.content:
It seems that nowadays you see in every city the same fashion stores and it is not easy to find unique accessories.

At Maho you will find a beautiful selection of high end hair accessories, gorgeous very unique cashmere shawls from the collection gentle earth http://gentleearth.ch/ wooden and silver jewelry and lots of other nice things.

Maho: Strehlgasse 13 or Bleicherweg 15a

entry.title: Fifa's soccer museum
entry.content:
140 million Swiss francs has been invested in the museum dedicated to the world’s most popular sport. The FIFA World Football Museum collects, exhibits and preserves significant artefacts, documents and photographs of international
association football.

At The Lab you will find an interactive learning space with hands-on activities, there is also a game area, a giant football pinball, a café, sports bar and shop. In short a museum for all ages of football lovers.

Tues - Sat. 10.00am -7.00pm, Sun 9.00am - 6.00pm.

http://www.fifamuseum.com/

entry.title: A world in colour
entry.content:
Pipilotti Rist’s solo exhibition at the Kunsthaus is a sensual, exhilarating and fearless show of her work
from 1986 until now. A dream in colour.

Kunsthaus Zürich until May 8, 2016. www.kunsthaus.ch

entry.title: The latest trends in contemporary art
entry.content:
The Migros Museum für Gegenwartskunst exhibits the latest trends in contemporary art. It is financed by Migros, the largest Swiss retailer and has pieces by John Armleder, Pamerla Rosenkranz and many more in its permanent collection.
  • Limmatstr. 270
  • Tue/Wed/Fri 11am - 6pm,
  • Thu 11am - 8pm, Sat/Sun 10am-5pm

entry.title: FOR THE MAN WITH BEARD
entry.content:
Womo - what original man own - open its first old fashioned barber shop outside Italy in the old town of Zurich.

If a man needs a shave (from 29.00) a haircut (from 49.00) a new fragrance he will find it at the Womo-Bullfrog on the Niederdorfstasse 18.

  • Monday through Friday 11.00am until 8.oopm
  • Saturday 09.00 until 6.00pm

http://www.womostore.com/

entry.title: World's only tree museum
entry.content:
Landscape architect Enzo Enea’s passion for trees led him to open a park like museum with 300 specimens of different trees,
some over 100 years old.

Works of renowned contemporary artists are shown among the trees.

Take the train to Rapperswil and then Bus 622 to Buechstrasse West (takes about 1 hour).

Check the website for the opening hours: www.enea.ch

entry.title: LULULEMON is now open in Zurich
entry.content:
Lululemon who makes yoga-inspired athletic clothing, has recently opened a store in the old town of Zurich. At their store they not only sell great looking athletic clothing but also host public events.

Every Thursday it is Run club from 6.30 until 7.30 pm or on Fridays from 6.00 until 7.00 pm they offer free yoga classes: first come, first mat. (ask at the Front desk of the Plattenhof or Townhouse to lend you a Yoga mat)

Check the schedule below.
Brunngasse 18
http://www.lululemon.com/stores/ch/zurich/zurich-showroom/events

entry.title: Enjoy Zermatt Cheese Fondue on Mt. Zurich
entry.content:
Until the 20th of March, the Alpine romance of Zermatt comes to Mt. Zurich.

The charming wooden hut, which used to be the post office in Zermatt, serves authentic Valais Cheese Fondue in a very cozy alpine setting.

Baracca at the Zürichberg: open Monday - Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm

  • Reservations required: www.baracca-zermatt.ch/zh

entry.title: Interested in watches?
entry.content:
Interested in old clocks and watches, visit the small exquisite watch museum, located beneath the popular Beyer Uhren & Juwelen shop. The clock and watch museum showcases time-telling instruments throughout the years.

The museum contains around 500 pieces dating from 1400 B.C. to the 21st century. Keep in mind the museum is only open Monday through Friday and operates on limited hours, from 2 to 6 p.m.

During special exhibitions, the museum may be open on Saturdays but check the Website or call (41 43 344 63 63) the store for more information.

entry.title: Palette - proud of our new cafe/bar
entry.content:
The Palette on Schützengasse 7, right on Bahnhofstrasse is offering healthy breakfast, homemade smoothies, Italian Espresso and Cappuccino. Mediterranean lunch and dinner snacks such as couscous with apricots, fennel feta and pomegranates, chicken pastis, meatballs with tomatoes and oriental spices, home made graved lox with soybeans, figs pecorino and basil.

Andy’s special drink creations such as vodka with dark chocolate, just to mention one, are legendary.

The atmosphere is very stylish and relaxed.

entry.title: Barfussbar - Bare foot bar
entry.content: The bare foot bar is the place with the most magnificent setting for chilling on a summer evening. It is housed in the Frauenbadi, which as the name says, is a women only public bath during the day. Every Thursday, Friday and Saturday after 20.00 it is transformed into a bar for both sexes. The dress code is strict: barefoot. Wednesday (Fish dinner) , Thursday (Bar), Sunday (Dance) 20.00 until 24.00 http://www.barfussbar.ch/

entry.title: Stand up paddle on the lake of Zurich
entry.content:
Combine surfing with kayaking and you’ve got stand up paddleboarding (SUP). SUP is the fastest- growing water sport in the world.
The Seebadi Enge rents the boards for CHF 35.00 an hour. The Seebadi Enge also serves a good cappuccino and is a great place
to relax and soak in the sun.
http://www.seebadenge.ch/wp/sup/

entry.title: The Fleamarket for all treasure- and bargain hunters
entry.content: I always like to visit a fleamarket when traveling. Zurich’s biggest fleamarket with about 500 traders is located on Bürkliplatz and is held every Saturday rain or shine form May until October. It’s a good place to find antiques and everyday trinkets.

entry.title: Enjoy a picnic on the lake
entry.content:
A Picnic, what better way to enjoy the great outdoors? Pick up an old fashioned picnic basket at the St. Adelhof just minutes away from the lake. Their Limmat baskets for two costs CHF 55.00. http://www.stadelhof.ch/
Stadelhoferstrasse 42, 8001 Zürich

entry.title: A beautiful terrace, the perfect place to relax above the Bahnhofstrasse
entry.content: Located above the Grieder Fashion house this beautiful inviting terrace, which nestles under a large tree is very popular with Zurich’s  “in crowd”. They serve cappuccinos, snacks and it is the perfect place to drink a “Cüpli” (glass of champagne) and relax after a day of shopping or sightseeing.

entry.title: Digital Art Installation on Bahnhofstrasse
entry.content:
Bahnhofstrasse 66 was from 1927 to 2012 the flagship store of BALLY. The house was designed by the Zurich Architects Häfeli, Moser & Steiger and the eye-catcher of the building were 5 balls attached to side of it with the logo of Bally.

When “Zara” moved their store into the building, the city of Zurich decided that the building (including the 5 balls) - which is protected by Swiss Heritage  Society - should still be adorned by the 5  BALLY balls.

For obvious reasons Zara was not  keen of having a name of a different brand on building of their Zurich flagship store. A solution was found: the 5 original Bally balls are stored and have been replaced by 5 balls that display by led lights a variation of 564 words, such as urban, story, theme etc.

The words are not allowed to display any advertisement, brands, political propaganda and were created by the Zurich company WBG.

entry.title: Visit Zürich's sweet spots that aren’t in the guidebooks
entry.content:
An original fun and delicious way to visit our city, and learn that it’s not all about milk chocolate in the Alps. Kerrin of MyKugelhopf, true connoisseur of desserts, confections and chocolate, will let her sweet tooth guide you around the charming old town to discover some of the city’s most irresistible sweets .
Sweet Zürich” tours are Tuesday to Friday afternoons at 2pm.
Tours stay small (2-8 people), last about 2.5 hours and cost CHF 85 per person. All you need are comfortable shoes and a love of sweets! 
http://mykugelhopf.ch/sweet-zurich-tour/

entry.title: Zurich's most famous sausage stand
entry.content: The Sternen Grill at Bellevue is fast food Zurich style, where you will get a grilled  Bratwurst, Cervelat, crusty bread rolls (Bürli), homemade spicy mustard and their famous Sternen Bier. It is not fancy, no place to sit down, the people behind the grill are not very friendly but it is still the place to be and you should definitely try one of their sausages. www.sternengrill.ch/

entry.title: Japanese Inspirations at the Kunsthaus - well curated exhibition
entry.content: The Museum Kunsthaus shows until May 10, 2015 a special exhibition featuring such well known painters as Monet, Gauguin, Van Gogh. Never before had the art, fashion and design of two cultural spheres come in as close contact as during the brief heyday of Japonsime. This phenomenon came about in the nineteenth century when Japan opened up to the world again after a period of almost complete isolation lasting more than two hundred years, triggering a lively exchange of ideas and goods. www.kunsthaus.ch

entry.title: Go to a movie theater in Zurich
entry.content:
I always like the experience of going to a movie theater in a foreign city. Almost all films in Zurich are shown in their original language (mostly English) with German subtitles. There are about 20 movie theaters in Zurich, but the three following ones are my favourites:

  • Kino Uto (one of the oldest ones),
  • Kino Riffraff (shows great studio films)
  • Kino Houdini (the newest movie theater )

entry.title: Restaurant George - high above the Casino and Zurich's rooftops
entry.content:
Welcome to the living room of the fictional host GEORGE. On their website George welcome you to his living room which can be described as: elegant, cultivated and distinguished. The restaurant is dominated by a lively bar in the center, live piano music and comfortable seating arrangements where you can enjoy good steaks, surf and turf as well as a variation of salads to start off your meal. The steaks are grilled to perfection, served with a sauce of your choice,  all the side dishes cost extra which makes the dining experience rather expensive.
http://george-grill.ch/

entry.title: Meat Enthusiasts
entry.content: Are you a steak lover? Then be sure to stop by Goodman’s Restaurant during your stay in Zürich. The magnificent set up surprises you the minute you walk into the Restaurant. Specials like the Sir Loin and T-bone steak are a must have and are worth every penny spent. Others include the Goodman’s Rib-eye, Filet and Porter house ranging from all sizes and remarkable tastes. (quite pricey) http://www.goodmanrestaurants.ch/

entry.title: In the mood for pancakes or waffles
entry.content: Zum Guten Gluck, is a bright coffee shop with a modern Scandinavian touch that serves delicious pancakes all day long. Their pancake creations range from sweet to savory, my favourite being the one with ricotta. They also serve a very good breakfast 7 days a week.

entry.title: Zukunft - a club dedicated to music with local and international DJ's and bands
entry.content: Zukunft is a rather  small club in the trendy Kreis 4 : a good place for  electro, house and crossover party styles. The entrance is not easy to find, hidden in passage next to Bar 3000. It’s not your see and to be seen club but  rather a place where good music and drinks are the main attraction. Hipsters and Rockers  party until the break of dawn. Open Thursday trough Saturday as of 11.00 pm. http://www.zukunft.cl/

entry.title: Odeon - a bar and coffeehouse that opened its doors 1911
entry.content:
ODEON 
A coffee house with a long history Odeon, centrally located on the Limmatquai next to Bellevue, is believed to be the birth place of Dadaism. The Odeon with its nostalgic ambience is legendary, open-minded and a place where Zurich meets.  http://www.odeon.ch/en/

entry.title: The Viadukt - 39 arches of hip shops
entry.content: There is a colorful mix of stores under the arches of the railway viaduct built in 1894. At the heart of it all is the covered Market where 20 farmer and local food vendors offer their specialities. Take the Tram 4 or 13 to Dammweg.

entry.title: Welcome to the World of Animals = a fun place for children
entry.content: The Zoo Museum at the University of Zurich Have a closer look at more than 1500 animals! While native animals are displayed on the ground floor, you can find animals from all over the world in their zoogeographic regions on the basement floor. The museum is located at the University of Zurich, and is a fun hands on exhibition . zminfo@zm.uzh.ch. Entrance is free, open Tuesday-Friday 09.00 - 17.00, Saturday/Sunday 10.00 - 17.00

entry.title: Heiliger Bimbam a Christmas Market of a different kind
entry.content: The focus is on vendors with innovative and individual design objects. Heiliger BIMBAM promises a personal and  inspirational shopping experience, there will be a DJ, Glühwein, cupcakes to make the last minute X-mas shopping experience a relaxing one. Thursday December 18 until Sunday December 21 2014 at the Maag Halle. http://www.montagsmarkt.ch/heiliger-bimbam/

entry.title: Einzigart unique trouvailles
entry.content: Einzigart is a shop that I rarely leave empty-handed even if I don’t plan to buy anything at all. You will find all kind of „stuff“ from little trinkets to small furniture, lots from local designers and all placed under the umbrella of DESIGN.  Josefstrasse 36, www.einzigart.ch

entry.title: Waldraud a concept store in the urban District 5
entry.content: Waldraud offers a playful approach to selective furnishings- and fashion ideas. The three co-owners from Switzerland, Sweden and Germany have a passion for international brands that are different, creative and often produced in small series.

entry.title: AuGust a restaurant for meat lovers
entry.content:
The Widder Hotel is the home of the butchers guild which dates back to 1336. What better place to open a restaurant that serves sausages, meat loaf, kidneys but also beef tartar in a stylish atmosphere. They don’t take reservation, you sit on long wooden tables and prizes are very fair for a 5* Hotel.
www.au-gust.ch

entry.title: The new creative hub in Zurich
entry.content: What used to be a place where thousands of liter of milk are being processed, the Tony dairy factory, is now the new creative hub of Zurich. The Zurich University of Arts teaches students in over 1400 classrooms all about art, design, film, music, theater …The new building itself is worth a trip to Zurich West but not be missed is the exhibition “100 years of Swiss design” at the new Museum of Design.

entry.title: Hot chocolat = memories of childhood
entry.content:
At Café Péclard (formerly Café Schober)on the Napfgasse 4, in the beautiful old town, they serve
a delicious rich and deeply intense hot chocolat. Their pastries are definitely also worth trying. http://peclard-zurich.ch

entry.title: Our Restaurant Kantorei sparkles in December
entry.content: Have a delicious meal at the Kantorei and visit the old town with its cobbled streets and  colorful Christmas lights that bring out the magic of Christmas. www.restaurant-kantorei.ch

entry.title: For the hikers, climb the Zurich mountain Üetliberg
entry.content: for the hikers amongst you, climb our “house-mountain” Üetliberg. At 900m you will have a view extending in all directions, showing the Zurichsee, the distance snow-capped peaks, the green countryside and of course the spires of Zurich far below. At the ridge of the Üetliberg you will find trails, providing hiking possibilies for an easy hour to 6 or more. For those of you who do not fancy the quite steep 500 climb to the top there is convenient public transportation who will take you all the way to the mountain top. On your hike you will certainly hear the Swiss greetings “Grüezi or Grüezi mitenand”.

entry.title: Hamam a wonderful place to relax
entry.content:
The Hamam is an incredibly important part of the oriental culture where you follow in long rituals for cleansing the body until the skin glows. The two Hamams in Zurich are the perfect place to escape a cold, rainy day.  As soon as you enter the Hamam Münstergasse you leave Zurich behind and think yourself in Morocco. There is no need to bring a bathing suit, you will be  provided with a  “pestemal” (a cotton cloth) that you  wrap around your naked body - kind of like the Romans used to do. You will then follow a ritual that takes you the various steam bath, rain forest shower or the cleansing station an in the end you can sip complimentary mint tea and relax in the Camekan. The entrance fee without massage CHF 43.00.
http://www.fitnesspark.ch/hamam-muenstergasse/

The newly opened Hamam Basar in Seefeld is located in the very nice Patumbah park, it has different opening hours for men and women and also hosts a Vegan Restaurant. The entrance fee is CHF 48.00 and includes the savon noir and Rhassoul the clay rich in nutrients that is a perfect tonic treatment for your entire body. https://www.hammambasar.ch/

entry.title: Ice Skating at the Dolder open air ice-skating rink
entry.content: The lake in and around Zurich very rarely freeze over, nevertheless ice skating is a very popular activity in Zurich. the Dolder open air ice-skating rink was built in 1930 and covering some 6,000 square metres, it remains to this day the largest one of its kind in Europe. Open daily, Nov. 1 until March 8,the entry price is CHF 8.00 and CHF 7.00 to rent ice-skates. www.doldersports.com

entry.title: Make your own beewax candle, a traditional Swiss pre-Christmas activity
entry.content:
When Kerzenziehen (candle making) starts at Bürkliplatz I know Christmas is just around the corner. In the pavillion on Bürkliplatz you  can make your own candle by dipping a wick into tubs of hot, molten wax.  You need is a bit of patience, as the wax needs to cool before you dip it again. Good to slow down for a while in the frantic pre-Christmas period. All the proceeds go to charity, you pay according to weight.
 Open daily from 10.00am until 8.00pm

entry.title: Musée Visionnaire just a short walk from the Townhouse and the Plattenhof
entry.content:
Be visionary - be welcome The new museum is an art foyer & and art-lending library (Artothek) operated by the Musée Visionnaire, a non-profit association. Changing exhibitions will allow visitors to discover and re-discover contemporary Art Brut | Outsider Art and experience it within the context of related art forms. Special social events will be dedicated to topical subjects touching upon the world of art and current public issues. 

museevisionnaire.wordpress.com/
